pageContext.claim: “Short-range missiles. We never made an agreement on that. I have no problem. We'll see what happens. But these are short-range missiles. They're very standard.”
pageContext.analysis: This missiles were not "standard." The North Korean missile in question is reportedly the KN-23 short-range missile, which has a range of just under 430 miles and can be outfitted with a nuclear device. In theory, it could hit any target in neighboring South Korea, parts of China, and go just beyond the shoreline of Japan. Foreign Policy magazine said the missile has the capability of hiding under standard radar detection methods.
